title: Hardware and Software Upgrade of Racing Boat Steering Wheel Interface
overview: This project was carried out within the AGH Solar Boat student research group as a improvement to the helmsman's user experience.
The goal was to upgrade the steering wheel interface by replacing the small, low-visibility LCD display with a significantly larger e-paper screen, improving readability in bright conditions.
In addition to the hardware upgrade, the parameter configuration and display layout were redesigned to provide a cleaner and more intuitive user interface, reducing complexity during operation.
highlights: Selected and purchased a suitable 3.52-inch Waveshare e-paper display.
Developed a custom driver from scratch due to incomplete and beta-stage manufacturer documentation.
Designed a new user interface layout and parameter arrangement for improved usability.
Created a new front panel in CAD to fit the larger display, then manufactured mounts using 3D printing and CNC routing.
Replaced the separate button and encoder with a single combined encoder-button component for menu navigation.
Integrated the new display and controls into the existing steering wheel, removing the old display.
results: The new, larger e-paper display significantly improved the helmsman's experience by displaying all key values on a single screen.
Writing the custom driver was the main technical challenge due to incomplete documentation.

Unfortunately, e-paper displays have a limited number of refresh cycles, and prolonged exposure to intense sunlight accelerates wear. To address this, I designed the mounting system to allow for easy replacement once or twice per year.
